item.title: 30 crazy camping tricks that will make your life easier
item.excerpt: We’ve entered the age where ‘glamping’ is a thing. Glamor camping, for those who mercifully had not heard about it till now, is a type of outing where one sleeps less under a tent and more in a fully appointed home that just happens to be under a canvas roof.

item.title: The Best Hike in Every State
item.excerpt: Hiking is the great equalizer. Everyone enjoys a long (or short) walk in a pretty place. But that doesn’t mean all hikes are created equal. Some are objectively better, with taller peaks, greener trees, and more flowery flowers.

39.credit: Photo: Dr Mary Gillham Archive Project/Creative Commons

item.title: Pig in Australia Steals 18 Beers from Campers, Gets Drunk, Fights Cow
item.excerpt: Forget crocodiles and snakes, the real animal threat in Australia is wild pigs. At least if you’re camping. At a campground in Western Australia over the weekend, a feral pig guzzled down 18 beers that had been left out improperly secured.

item.title: My Daughter Went Away to Camp and Changed
item.excerpt: When I look at my phone, I see my daughter leaving for camp on my home screen. She stands at the bottom of an airport escalator, an orange backpack over her shoulder. She'd cut her long, strawberry blond hair the day before, so the person smiling from under the carrot top doesn't look familiar.

item.title: Five Ways Hiking Is Good for You
item.excerpt: I’m a hiker—“born to hike,” as my husband likes to joke. It does my heart and soul good to strap on a pack and head out on a trail, especially when I’m alone and can let my mind wander where it will.

item.title: Yewande Komolafe’s 10 Essential Nigerian Recipes
item.excerpt: The saying refers not to just one single element, but to the variety of ingredients in Nigerian cuisine that add heat to a dish: the mild tingle and smoke of selim peppers, the sudden rush of alligator peppers, the sustained heat of a habanero.

1.credit: ...Johnny Miller for The New York Times. Food Stylist: Rebecca Jurkevich. Prop Stylist: Paige Hicks

2.credit: ...Johnny Miller for The New York Times. Food Stylist: Rebecca Jurkevich. Prop Stylist: Paige Hicks

item.title: 10 Most Breathtaking Day Hikes in the U.S.
item.excerpt: The United States is home to some of the most diverse landscapes on the planet, ranging from barren deserts and vast canyons to lush forests and snow-capped mountains. Because of this, it's no surprise that it also has some of the most spectacular and accessible hiking trails in the world.

item.title: Homemade KIND Bars
item.excerpt: Are you a fan of KIND bars like me? They are by far my favorite non-homemade treat. Lucky for me, they're made with wholesome ingredients and are highly rated on many lists of nutritional bars. I'll take these over a candy bar any day.

item.title: Red Wine Hot Chocolate Is a Thing, and It’s (Surprisingly) Delicious
item.excerpt: Frosé? That’s a summer drink. Hot toddies, eggnog, mulled wine? Please, those are for your parents. No, no, the must-have drink of winter 2016, at least according to a small but dedicated circle of food blogs, is red wine hot chocolate.

1.caption: The finished hot chocolate red wine, topped with marshmallows.

item.title: 26 hiking trails around the world that should be on your bucket list
item.excerpt: The world is a beautiful place, and there's no better way to take in the sights than a good hike. Below is a list of breathtaking trails that span all difficulty levels.

item.title: A 500-mile solo hike cured my loneliness
item.excerpt: The journey began at an unassuming trailhead on the outskirts of Denver, Colorado. It was early July, and the morning sun was already unpleasantly hot. I hoisted a 40-lb. backpack onto my shoulders, paused for a photo, and started walking.

item.title: Guide to Patagonia: what to do, how to do it, and where to stay
item.excerpt: For my first forays into Patagonia, in the 1990s, I left behind my guidebooks and travelogues. Travelling light, I was blown away by big, jagged mountaintop glaciers and – more literally – the fierce westerlies that gusted summer long.

item.title: The Benefits of Hammock Camping
item.excerpt: Editor’s note: This promotional post was written by the guys at Huckberry and the AoM team. When you think about camping, what image comes to mind? Probably a tent. Tents and camping trips have truly become inextricably linked over the decades.

5.caption: It’s definitely more comfortable to sleep by yourself when you’re hammock camping, but if you do want to sleep next to your main squeeze, get a hammock designed to hold two, like the Roo or the Double Parachute

item.title: 77 Healthy Slow Cooker Recipes
item.excerpt: Crazy schedules, long work hours, and tempting takeout menus make it tough to even think about cooking most nights during the week. Despite the inconvenience, firing up the stove or oven is almost always cheaper and healthier than ordering in or eating out.
